availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Frances Owsley Sr. (Cumberland, Kentucky, bank cashier.)

body.p: Cumberland, Kentucky, merchant, farmer, and bank cashier. Cumberland, Kentucky, native. Married to Ellen King Owsley. Father of Adie F. Owsley. Married to Mary Agnes Bledsoe Owsley. Father of William Frances Owsley Jr., Laurah S. Owsley, and Lela E. Owsley. Merchant and farmer in Cumberland County in 1850. Employed Clay Taylor in Cumberland County in 1850. Bank cashier in Cumberland County in 1860. Owner of nine enslaved people in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Cumberland County, Burkesville, p. 555B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Cumberland County, District No. 1, p. 659.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Cumberland County, District No. 1, p. 6A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Cumberland County, Burkesville, p. 5A-B.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File #2140.
"Pioneer Passes Away" The Adair County News (KY), March 11, 1903, Newspapers.com, https://www.newspapers.com/clip/97691530/obituary-for-william-francis-owsley/.
"William Francis Owsley Sr. (1813-1910)," Find A Grave, Memorial #93860804, accessed March 15, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/93860804.
